frontmatter.title: Liz Pelly, The Baffler
frontmatter.subtitle: Presented by the Initiative for Digital Public Infrastructure at UMass Amherst
frontmatter.author: Initiative for Digital Public Infrastructure
frontmatter.excerpt: Critic and music journalist Liz Pelly joins us for a fascinating interview about why the Spotify model is so bad for musicians and what that might mean for podcasters. Liz is a veteran of the DIY music community as a former member of the Silent Barn collective in Brooklyn, and a stalwart of independent journalism with her own publication The Media, and pieces published Rolling Stone, Pitchfork, and the New York Times.
